bibl.title: Chung Him and Seid Yam v. Henry M. White. Bond for the Release of Jung Him
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States
Filed in the United States District Court
Bond For the Release of Jung Him
In the Matter of the Application of Jung Him et al for a writ of Habeas Corpus.

KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, that we Jung Him, as principal, and A.V. Williams and Lillian Williams, of Seattle, Washington, as sureties, jointly and severally acknowledge ourselves to be indebted to the United States of America, in the sum of one thousand dollars ($1,000.00), lawful money of the United States, to be levied of our goods and chattels, lands and tenements, upon this condition;

Whereas, on the 6th day of December, 1920, the said Jung Him was by the judgment and decree of this court ordered released and discharged from the custody of the United States Commissioner of Immigration, Luther Weedin; and whereas, the said Luther Weedin (but by his predecessor in office, Henry M. White), has appealed from said judgment and decree to the Circuit Court of Appeals, and by an order of this court, dated December 6, 1920, it was provided and directed that said Jung Him be released from custody upon the furnishing of a good and sufficient bond in the sum of $1,000.00, to be approved by the United States District Attorney;

NOW, THEREFORE, if the said Jung Him shall submit himself to the custody of the said Luther Weedin, as Commissioner of Immigration, whenever he shall be directed so to do by the Circuit Court of Appeals, and shall abide by and perform any order, judgment or decree that may be made by said Circuit Court of Appeals from time to time, then this recognizance to be void; otherwise to remain in full force and effect.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24 day of June, 1922.
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle
United States of America, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

A.V. WILLIAMS and LILLIAN WILLIAMS, being first duly sworn, according to law, on their oaths, respectively, do say, each for himself and herself, that he is one of the sureties who signed and sealed the within bond; that he is above the age of twenty-one years; that he is a bona fide resident of the State of Washington, and property holder therein; that he is neither a counselor nor attorney at law, Sheriff of a County, Clerk of Superior Court, nor other officer whatever of any court whatsoever; and that he each is worth the full sum of $3000.00, over and above all his debts and liabilities whatsoever, exclusive of property exempt from execution.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24 day of June, 1922.
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle
The foregoing bond approved this 24 day of June, 1922.
The foregoing bond approved this 24 day of June, 1922.
